summary: This document is an FBI interview summary (302) with Dan Besselsen regarding Interlochen Center for the Arts records related to Jeffrey Epstein. It details Epstein's donations to Interlochen, applications for a camper (likely an associate), and the school's record-keeping practices. The interview was conducted via WebEx on November 17, 2021.

persons.name: Dan Besselsen
persons.context: Interlochen employee providing information to the FBI about Jeffrey Epstein's donations and a specific camper's applications to the arts camp and high school.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as a donor to Interlochen Center for the Arts, with a donor file dating back to the 1980s. His donations funded scholarships and specific programs.

persons.name: Dave Stave
persons.context: Former Chief Financial Officer of Interlochen, copied on a donor acknowledgment letter related to Epstein.

persons.name: Pat Kessel
persons.context: Current Chief Financial Officer of Interlochen, copied on a donor acknowledgment letter related to Epstein.

persons.name: Peg Johnson
persons.context: Interlochen employee involved in fundraising and finance, copied on correspondence regarding Epstein's donations.

persons.name: Ambrose
persons.context: Mentioned as the sender of an email from Interlochen's operations department, found in Epstein's donor file.

persons.name: Dan Bauer
persons.context: Interlochen employee mentioned in an email found in Jeffrey Epstein's donor file.

connections.description: Besselsen is an Interlochen employee providing information to the FBI about Epstein's donor history and related records.
Epstein was a donor to Interlochen, and Johnson was an employee copied on correspondence regarding his donations and fund management.
Epstein paid tuition for an unnamed camper who attended Interlochen's summer camp and high school.

events.title: Summer Camp Application
events.description: An application for Interlochen's summer arts camp was submitted, likely for an associate of Jeffrey Epstein. The application appears to have been faxed.

events.title: Series of Camp Applications
events.description: A series of summer camp applications for the same camper were submitted to Interlochen for the summers of 1994, 1995, and 1996.

events.title: High School Enrollment
events.description: The same camper attended Interlochen Arts Academy high school as a junior and senior, with Jeffrey Epstein paying some of the tuition.

events.title: FBI WebEx Interview
events.description: FBI Special Agents conducted a WebEx interview with Dan Besselsen to gather information on Interlochen records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was a long-term donor to Interlochen Center for the Arts, with a donor file dating back to the 1980s.
Epstein paid for an unnamed individual to attend Interlochen's summer arts camp (1994-1998) and high school (1999-2001).
Interlochen retains educational records for 99 years and keeps comprehensive donor records indefinitely, including all correspondence.
The document references Government Exhibits (GX 741-744) which include donor records, camp applications, and student records related to Epstein.
An 'Epstein Lodge' existed on the Interlochen campus but has since been renamed.
